sensuality.description: Prioritizing worldly pleasures and experiences over spiritual development is considered sinful as it violates the First Commandment by placing temporal desires above one's eternal relationship with God.

sensuality.question:
Did you use controlled substances to detach from reality? 

Maintaining controlled substances deliberately impairs your God-given reason and free will, and an attempt to avoid dealing with life's challenges rather than facing them with God's help.

scandal.question: Did you try to lead someone else into committing a sinful act?
scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

impenitence.question: Have I held onto a particular sin, stubbornly refusing to acknowledge my wrongdoing?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

impenitence.question: Have I refused to acknowledge and turn away from a particular sin, even when confronted with my wrongdoing?

callousness.question: Did I turn away from visiting someone who was sick in my community?
callousness.description: This is sinful because it violates Jesus's direct command to care for the sick (Matthew 25:36) and fails to fulfill our fundamental Christian duty to show compassion and mercy to those who are suffering.

blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while being aware that my heart was not properly disposed to receiving it?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

blasphemy.question: Did I speak the name of God as a byword or curse, showing disrespect for His divine nature through my words?
blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted my comfort and security in this stage of life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Have you entertained doubts about God's existence?
